text: The Nok civilization suggests that

options.A: Nigeria passed through different stages of development
options.B: civilization in the area began with the Stone Age
options.C: the people of Nigeria came from the East
options.D: Nigerian civilization is related to that of Greek.

text: The development of mircoliths is associated with the

options.C: Iron Age
options.D: Early Stone Age.

text: In pre-colonial Nigeria, intergroup contacts were encourage mostly by

options.C: marriage ties
options.D: political ties

text: Which of the following is the most important source of the history of the Hausa states?

options.C: The Kano Chronicle.
options.D: The Arab traders’ account.

text: The Yoruba background to the Oba of Benin is emphasized by the

options.A: similarities of Benin and Ife arts
options.C: relationship between Oranmiyan and Ogiso dynasties
options.D: Oranmiyan legend in Benin history.

text: European traders did not venture into the interior of Nigeria before the 19th century because

options.A: they were ignorant of the area
options.B: the African middlemen served their needs
options.C: of their fear of the African middlemen
options.D: they were very few in number.

text: The Africans transported across the Atlantic as slaves were mostly

options.C: disabled persons
options.D: people with low income.

text: The jihadists emerged victorious in Gobir because

options.C: they had superior weapons
options.D: the masses supported them.

text: Rabeh’s greatest challenge after conquering Borno was

options.C: reviving the ailing economy
options.D: safeguarding the religion of Islam.

text: Christianity spread fast in Nigeria because it

options.C: preached social equality
options.D: was opposed to oppression by rulers.

explanation:
The history of Christianity in Nigeria can be traced back to the 15th century, when the Portuguese were the first Europeans to arrive the shores of the region via the Atlantic.  The Portuguese brought Christianity with them but were unable to successfully plant Christianity because of their involvement in slave trade. It can be argued that the actual intent behind their voyage was more in the interest of slave business, than it was for missionary goals and objectives. Most of the Portuguese slave traders took Nigerian slaves to be resold in the Americas and parts of Europe. Hence, they were not committed to missionary work.
After the abolition of the slave trade in the British Empire in 1833, things took an interesting turn. Slaves captured by European masters were freed and sent to Freetown in Sierra Leone. These slaves had lived with their masters in Europe and America, and many had accepted Christianity at the time they were freed. In 1841, freed slaves arrived in Sierra Leone and gradual changes began in British policies. Slavery was frowned upon, and the British government took it upon itself to enforce new laws and policies, in a bid to stop trading and owning slaves.
Towards the end of the 19th century, some of the freed slaves began to retrace their ways back home. Freed slaves from Nigeria sailed from Sierra Leone to Lagos and Badagry on vessels acquired from slave courts in Freetown. Some of the freed slaves settled in Abeokuta (capital of Ogun State) and other cities in western Nigeria. They also had opportunities to acquire education offered by the Church Missionary Society (CMS). They practiced Christianity and preached the gospel to their family and kinsmen.  Over time, a good number of former slaves converted to Christianity. One of those slaves worthy of mention was Samuel Ajayi Crowther. He was captured at age 12 by Fulani slave raiders and sold to Portuguese slave traders. He later regained his freedom and went on to become the first African to be ordained bishop by the Christian Missionary Society (CMS) in addition to his consecration as bishop of the Niger territory. Samuel was one of the pioneers of local Christian missionary work in Nigeria and contributed to the translation of the Bible into Yoruba language.

text: Ibadan-Ijebu relations in the 19th Century became hostile as a result of

options.C: British annexation of Lagos
options.D: Ibadan’s attempt to reach the coast.

text: The Ekiti Parapo was aimed at

options.B: restoring the dignity of the Alaafin
options.C: reducing the powers of Ibadan
options.D: forming a federated government.

text: The Uzama title holders in Benin Kingdom were responsible for

options.A: advising the Oba in the administration of the Kingdom
options.B: punishing erring members of the royal family
options.C: defending the Kingdom from external attacks
options.D: settling disputes between the Oba and other chiefs.

text: Britain suppressed the trans-Atlantic slave trade because

options.A: there was no more market for slaves in America
options.C: the Christian missions preached against it
options.D: it became unfavourable to her industrial progress.

text: The main goal of the British expedition against the Aro was to

options.B: eliminate all opposition to their presence in the hinterland
options.C: pave the way for the Christianization of Igboland
options.D: liberate the Igbo from Aro bondage.

text: A major reason for the introduction of indirect rule in Northern Nigeria was to

options.A: ensure perfect control of the economy
options.B: further weaken the position of the elite class
options.C: assist the Christian missionaries in their activities
options.D: secure cheap labour for railway construction.

text: Nationalist activities developed earlier in British West Africa than in French West Africa because

options.A: British colonies were accorded equal status with Britain
options.B: Britain had more colonies than France
options.C: African chiefs in French colonies were highly respected
options.D: of the systems of administration adopted by the colonial powers.

text: The main reason for the construction of the railway from Port-Harcourt into the hinterland was the

options.A: discovery of tin in Jos area
options.B: discovery of a deep sea harbor at Port-Harcourt
options.C: discovery of coal at Udi
options.D: need to evacuate export crops from the hinterland.

text: During the colonial period, agricultural policy in Nigeria was designed to

options.A: raise the financial base of the country
options.B: make the economy compete favourably in the world market
options.C: provide raw materials for British industries
options.D: demonstrate Britain’s concern for the development of its colonies.

text: The Nigerian Youth Movement collapsed as a result of

options.B: shortage of funds to run its affairs
options.C: the harassment of its leadership by government
options.D: the break-up of its leadership.

text: The NCNC London Delegate pressed for

options.A: free primary education for all Nigerian children
options.C: a revision of the Richards Constitution
options.D: outright independence for Nigeria.

text: The Lyttlelton Constitution is considered a landmark in the history of Nigeria, because it

options.A: created a federal structure of government for the country
options.B: made ministers accountable to the electorate
options.C: recognized Lagos as a federal territory
options.D: gave ministers full authority over their ministries.

text: Protests by trade unions in Nigeria during the colonial period were aimed at

options.C: obtaining specific benefits for members
options.D: fighting corruption among government officials.

text: Which of the following served as federal ministers under the Tafawa Balewa Administration?

options.A: Alhaji Muhammadu Ribadu and Chief Festus Okotie-Eboh.
options.B: Chief Kolawole Balogun and Alhaji Adamu Ciroma.
options.C: Alhaji Muhammadu Inuwa Wada and Chief Richard Akinjide
options.D: Chief Aja Nwachukwu and Alhaji Umaru Dikko.

text: An important function of FEDECO during the 1979 elections was

options.B: promulgating the new constitution into law
options.C: swearing-in of elected officials
options.D: delineating electoral constituencies.

text: A major reason for the military intervention in Nigeria’s politics in 129966 was the

options.A: pro-West posture of Nigeria’s foreign policy
options.C: attempt by government to retire top military officers
options.D: crisis of the 1964 General Elections.

text: Major General Aguiyi-Ironsi introduced a unitary system of government because

options.A: it was the wish of the people
options.B: of the command structure of the military
options.C: he wanted more revenue for the central government
options.D: other military officers were planning to overthrow him.

text: The strategy for accelerated agricultural development of the Obasanjo regime in the 1970’s focused on

options.A: improving transportation network to the rural areas
options.C: achieving food self-sufficiency
options.D: establishing new marketing boards.

text: The Berber scholar, al-Mukhtar, contributed to the success of the Masina Jihad by

options.B: preparing the ground through the Qadiriyyah Brotherhood
options.C: mobilizing various groups to fight for Seku Ahmadu
options.D: appealing to Ardo Moudo to support Seku Ahmadu.

text: The establishment of Freetown in 1822 facilitated

options.C: humanitarian activities
options.D: the improvement of agriculture.

text: Nineteenth century Egyptian nationalism principally aimed at

options.B: forming a constitutional government in Egypt
options.C: bringing down the monarchy
options.D: ensuring Egyptian independence.

text: The Battle of Tel el-Kebir was fought between

options.C: the Khedive and the Wafdists
options.D: Napoleon and the Mamluks.

text: Morocco was of strategic importance to the European countries because

options.C: it possessed good mineral resources
options.D: it provided an entrance to the Mediterranean.

text: The Mahdists revolt in the Sudan was successful

options.A: They believed they had a superior faith
options.C: the Egyptian army was poorly trained
options.D: General Gordon was an incompetent commander.

text: Sayyid Said increased the volume of trade with the Europeans by

options.A: allowing them to take control of the trade with the hinterland
options.C: allowing European consuls to reside in Zanzibar
options.D: making English the lingua franca of Zanzibar.

text: One of the main aims of the British conquest of Buganda was to

options.A: gain access to the cape of Good Hope
options.B: pain control of the gold mines of Bunyoro
options.C: prevent other Europeans from controlling the source of the Nile
options.D: take control of the trade routes in the area.

text: The survival of Ethiopia as an independent polity was as a result of the

options.C: strong economic base of the kingdom
options.D: introduction of a compulsory military service.

text: The Mfecane resulted in the

options.A: division and fragmentation of the Zulu nation
options.C: decrease in Boer influence in South Africa
options.D: dispersal of the Zulu to the Katanga copper belt.

text: The 1960 Sharpeville revolt was specifically against

options.C: pass laws
options.D: marriage laws.

text: A major consequence of the Great Trek was the

options.A: restriction of movement of the whites in South Africa
options.B: agitation for black-white equality in South Africa
options.C: annexation of white communities by the Africans
options.D: the expansion of white communities in South Africa.

text: One feature of European diplomacy in the scramble for Africa was

options.C: negotiating with African leaders for territories
options.D: reconciling differences over territorial claims.

text: The French colonial policy of assimilation failed in Africa because

options.B: the African elite were opposed to it
options.C: it was not consistently implemented
options.D: it was expensive to implement.

text: Which of the following was one of the demands of the National Congress of British West Africa?

options.A: Establishment of a university in each of the colonies.
options.B: Expulsion of all Syrians and Lebanese from the colonies.
options.C: Election of Africans into each colony’s council.
options.D: Restriction of the activities of Christian missionaries in the colonies.

text: The nationalist movement in Nigeria during the post-war period was primarily led by

options.C: students
options.D: local chiefs.

text: One of the objectives for the formation of the South African Native Congress in 1912 was to

options.C: retrieve all lands seized by the whites
options.D: integrate the various groups and races.

text: In 1973, Nigeria broke diplomatic relations with Israel because of Israel’s

options.C: support for Biafra during the war
options.D: raid on Entebbe airport in Uganda.

text: King Leopold’s colonial ventures in the Congo were aimed at

options.A: making Belgium a great colonial power
options.B: carving out an empire for himself
options.C: putting a stop to domestic slave trade in the area
options.D: introducing Western education to the people.

text: In Africa, the colonial authorities introduced modern means of transportation in order to

options.C: encourage urban development
options.D: promote import-export trade.
